data.title: The Sound of a Landscape. The Northumberland Coast in Art, Sound and Poetry. MiE Fielding
data.meta_description: 'The Sound of a Landscape - The Northumberland Coast in Art, Sound and Poetry'. by Sound designer and artist MiE Fielding, with poetry by Harry Gallagher.
data.text:
The Northumberland coast stretches for approximately 100 km from Marshall Meadows, north of Berwick-Upon-Tweed, to the mouth of the River Tyne. Its northern section of 64 km is designated an Area Of Outstanding Natural Beauty and includes magnificent castles, several islands, including the world famous Farne’s archipelago and the pretty villages of Bamburgh, Craster, Alnmouth and Warkworth. To the south of Coquet Island, lies the stunningly beautiful Druridge Bay and the coastal delights of Newbiggin-by-the-sea, Blyth Beach, Seaton Sluice, St Mary’s Island and picturesque Tynemouth. In this book, artist, author and sound recordist MiE Fielding brings us the Northumberland coast in all its wild splendour. His evocative and unique artwork is complimented by the wonderful words of Cullercoats poet Harry Gallagher. The book is further enhanced with 360 degree ‘Ambisonic’ sound recordings, available to enjoy by scanning the accompanying QR code, bringing ‘The Sound of a Landscape' Priced at £24.99 + £3.95 p+p order your copy here.

' The poetry and verse in the vernacular by Harry Gallagher adds a depth and local feeling to the imagery. The addition of the Ambisonic soundscapes gives the reader a whoosh from the impression of being on the coast. Listening to the actual environments provides this gorgeous and thoughtful book with a whole new sense of immersion '. Amazon Review

The Sound of a Landscape - The Northumberland Coast in Art, Sound and Poetry
